reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Driving into a foreign city can be a real test but we'd sorted through a handful of hotels we were considering and while waiting for a traffic light to change, looked to the left and Voila! Not that it looked like your typical hotel. There, in the walls to the old city was a door and above it a sign reading "Hotel del Cardenal". The convenience of a free and open city owned parking lot made it easy to stop, park and investingate.
reviews.title: A Real Find, An Easy Find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The door lead to a mystical Spanish garden replete with fountains. Ahead, at the base of the steep hill crowned by the Old City was a two storey building while off to the left was a similar structure. While there is no lobby, the front desk immediately inside the door made registration easy and soon we were booked into an imaculate and comfortable room on the first floor. Outside our heavy wooden door was a lounge with overstuffed seating where we later chatted with a number of other guests. And I will add that above the bed was a Cardinal's coat of arms.
reviews.title: A class act at a great price

likes.liked: — Historic, classy rooms, outdoor areas, great value, quiet, free indoor parking
likes.disliked: — Our room had no outside view, Wifi was not free

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The building we had seen to our left housed a gourmet restaurant open for breakfast, lunch and dinner and very popular with tourists and locals not staying at the hotel. No wonder given the quality of the food.
reviews.title: Beautiful Gardens, Nice Restaurant

reviews.text: While the hotel has a real historical feeling to it equal to a Parador, there are a couple of other beatures offered. First is the free parking in front. Second is the hotel's proximity to an escalator to take people up the steep hill into the Old Town. Third is the fact that the main gate of the Old Town is only a few yards away from the hotel for those choosing to walk up or down. For us, this was a real find as well as an easy find.
reviews.title: An Oasis Of Calm and Tranquility

reviews.text: We loved the Hostal del Cardenal, it was one of our favorite hotels in our travels to Europe. This was once the mansion of the Cardinal of Toledo and it shows it everywhere you look!
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.text: Very good hotel to stay if you are staying in Toledo. It is right at the base of the main hill and you can walk to the top in a few minutes. The entire property is lovely. The restaurant is beautifully situated in a garden.
reviews.title: Good Place
charming
reviews.text: Unless you wish to stay in the old Toledo, this is the best place to stay.

reviews.title: utterly charming
reviews.text: At the base of the town, literally a part of the town wall. It was a bit difficult to find by car despite having located it on a map. There is a small public lot in front which is very busy during the day. Park here and run in to the front desk. We wound up parking (for free) on the street only a block away for the next three days.

Aside from the parking situation (they have their own impossible to find lot farther from the hotel than where we parked), the hotel is great. The restaurant bar was great for meeting other (European) travelers. The nearby escalator made getting to the core of the town quick and easy.
reviews.title: Love at First Sight

reviews.text: P.S. If you want to see the "view of Toledo", take the tourist tram that circles the town but make sure you are NOT sitting in the first of the two cars. Trust me.
reviews.title: Delightful hotel

reviews.text: I agree that the grounds are more impressive than the rooms - but the rooms aren't bad, either. The restaurant was a bit of a disappointment - though, again, it wasn't terrible. What I liked most was the serene feeling of being inside a walled retreat, away from the hustle and bustle of the traffic-filled streets. And this is despite the bell tower that tolls every 30 minutes. With the window closed, it's not bad. I asked the gentleman at the front desk about it when we were checking out. He smiled sardonically and said, "It belongs to the city - it's not ours!"
reviews.title: Very nice - despite the tolling bell
charming hotel
reviews.text: If you drive, try to arrive there after 3 or 4 pm and park in the lot right in front (temporarily illegally, if you have to). Then you need to move the car to the underground lot, just a 2-minute walk away. (It's very safe). You can also go right to the underground lot, though it helps to get directions to it from the front desk.

reviews.title: Magic place
reviews.text: I would definitely stay there again.

reviews.title: Like living in a cardinal's palace!
reviews.text: The Hostal Del Cardenal, a 17th century Cardinal's palace, was in an excellent location a few minutes walk from the escalators which take you up to the "old" Toledo. We were impressed with the well kept gardens - the hotel was an oasis in the middle of "brown". The rooms were medieval-looking, but comfortable with modern bathrooms. We had dinner at the adjoining restaurant - food was just ok with exception of an excellent appetizer plate and good house wine.

reviews.title: an ossais
reviews.text: We just brought overnight bags and left the large suitcases in our car - there are lots of steps to climb to enter the hotel and it would be difficult to carry heavy suitcases. Also there is temporary parking in front of the hotel, but cars have to be moved by a certain time - there is a public parking garage nearby.

We stayed here with our 15 year old son in Aug for 2 nights. This was a delighful hotel with a suberb outdoor resturant where we had dinner. The gardens were beautiful and you had the feeling you were in a castle. Definatly we would stay again.
reviews.title: Magical and Romantic

reviews.text: I concur with prior reviews. The rooms were a bit austure but the grounds were absolutely spectacular. Climbing the walls of the city at sunset was incredible. The restuarant was very good value and the staff very friendly. I would heartily recommend it.
reviews.title: Lots of history-minimal modern amenities

reviews.text: We got lost trying to find this hotel, as the directions that reception had given us from the train station were innaccurate. We finally found this hotel hidden away at the bottom of the old city, built into the city gates. As far as the charm goes, this hotel has a lot of history behind it and has an amazing garden/entryway into the hotel. However, the hotel is not really centrally located if you want to go to the old city. Yes, it is at the bottom of the old city so I suppose it's closer than being in the modern part of town, but since it's at the bottom, you don't want to walk up and down the steep hill more than you need to.
reviews.title: Much-needed peace and quiet in Old Toledo
